meanings.definition: A bag or sack used for carrying belongings on one's back.
meanings.sent1: I packed my snacks in a packsacks for our hike.
meanings.sent2: She carried her books in a packsacks to school every day.
meanings.sent3: The packsacks was so full of toys, it looked like a treasure chest.
meanings.sent4: His packsacks was a loyal companion on all his adventures.
meanings.sent5: The colorful packsacks stood out in the sea of backpacks.

meanings.definition: To fill a packsack with items for transport.
meanings.sent1: I packsacksed my clothes for the weekend trip.
meanings.sent2: They packsacksed the supplies for the camping trip.
meanings.sent3: He packsacksed the bag so full, it almost burst at the seams.
meanings.sent4: She packsacksed her heart with memories of their time together.
meanings.sent5: The team packsacksed their gear efficiently for the expedition.
